title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 04 August 2014 - XWiki
content:
<polx> has quit  
00:13 <abusenius\_> has quit

09:40 <rihbyne> has quit

10:06 <lucaa> has quit  
10:07 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:37 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:52 <rihbyne> has joined #xwiki  
11:04 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <rihbyne> anyone ther  
11:08 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:20 <gdelhumeau> Stack trace when I start a fresh instance: http://hastebin.com/dakepohije.avrasm  
11:22 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
11:24 <ClemensR> gdelhumeau:  does the error go away after loading a page for the first time, or does it persist?  
11:24 <gdelhumeau> ClemensR: only the first time  
11:27 <ClemensR> it looks like context.getWiki() returns null (?) maybe the initalization has not been complete ...  
11:28 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: It seems webjars does not work anymore  on  my fresh instance  
11:28 <gdelhumeau> ex: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/webjars/resources/path?value=bootstrap/3.2.0/js/bootstrap.js returns nothing, but it used to return the correct file  
11:29 <mflorea> any exception in the log?  
11:29 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: no  
11:30 <mflorea> should be easy to debug  
11:38 <gdelhumeau> actually it's not an 404 error  
11:38 <gdelhumeau> but an empty file as an answer  
11:41 <gdelhumeau> BTW, should we release M1 this week? Most of the developers are on holidays  
11:43 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: when I remove "this.container.getResponse().setContentType(tika.detect(resourceStream, resourceName));" it works again  
11:43 <gdelhumeau> maybe tika change the state of the resourceStream  
11:44 <mflorea> the javadoc says it doesn't  
11:44 <rihbyne> gdelhumeau: I have fundamental java experience and I want to start contribting to java open source projects.should I consider xwiki or apache-commons or any other you would recommend.  
11:45 <gdelhumeau> rihbyne: if you ask me... I would say XWiki  
11:45 <mflorea> there is even a test that proves the input stream is not affected, but it may not cover all use cases  
11:45 <gdelhumeau> rihbyne: There is less contributors so yo could bring more noticable things :)  
11:49 <rihbyne> gdelhumeau: ok.I am searching for open source java projects. and I also wanna tell you that my discovered interest are in distributed computing.  
11:49 <rihbyne> so gdelhumeau what you wanna say about it.  
11:49 <rihbyne> \*  
11:55 <mflorea> rihbyne: see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing . There are many ways you can contribute. XWiki is a web application and platform so knowledge in distributed computing surely helps. I guess you're interested in http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing#HContributeCode  
11:56 <mflorea> you should register on the xwiki-devs mailing list (see http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/MailingLists )  
12:01 <lucaa> has quit  
12:02 <rihbyne> has quit  
12:05 <rihbyne> has joined #xwiki  
12:05 <rihbyne> sorry guys did I miss anything ?  
12:11 <cjd> nope, it's fairly quiet today  
12:14 <ClemensR> rihbyne: you can always check the log if you think you missed something, e.g. for today:  http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/IRC/xwikiArchive20140804  :)  
12:15 <rihbyne> gdelhumeau:  mflorea ClemensR I have not familiar with xwiki.I want to contribute code so I should join the dev mailing list? also I would like to know the experience involved in apache-commons project and xwiki.  
12:15 <rihbyne> \*am  
12:17 <ClemensR> well, you can first read the pages about contributing that mflorea has posted above  
12:19 <ClemensR> you maybe also want to try to build XWiki from source  http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building  ... though you can also just download it and try it out and then see of you can improve one of the existing extensions  
12:20 <rihbyne> ok yeah ClemensR. but what you have to say on apache-commons?  
12:21 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: M1 should be today  
12:22 <Enygma`> last time I talked with Vincent, he asked me to handle the release, either directly, or to find someone  
12:23 <gdelhumeau> ok  
12:23 <ClemensR> rihbyne: well, that are a lot of different smaller projects, mostly libraries. If you want to contribute there I think you need a use case for the library so you understand what this or that library is good for. Then I never contributed to commons (except sending a patch once I think - about typos in the javadoc :))  
12:23 <Enygma`> I`ve already started looking into the build/test problems  
12:29 <rihbyne> so ClemensR apache-commons libraries are fundamental libraries and one uses them and contributes to them when they need them in their projects?  
12:33 <ClemensR> yes, for example XWiki actually uses some apache-comons libs; you can find them in the webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib subdirectory ... all the files starting with common-\* :)  
12:37 <rihbyne> ok  
12:40 <rihbyne> has quit  
12:58 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki
